page.title: 05Greenhouse Crops Mickleton
page.content: Sweet pepper plants are bought from Holland.They come about April or May. These and lettuce are the main crops now.The lettuces are grown in winter and spring.The peppers are grown in summer and autumn.As well as tomatoes and sprouts they used to grow beetroot and parsnips.Mechanical packers were used for tomato packing.There are three tractors.Electronic watering systems are used in the greenhouses. They use about two million gallons a year.Water is collected off the green- house roofs into a pond,and other water is pumped from springs owned by Webbs.Some of the disused land is rented out to farmers.There are ten old houses on the land that were used in the past for workers. The rows of Webb's greenhouses,and others,can be clearly seen from the hills around Mickleton.
